text: The German Colony in Jerusalem is a neighbourhood in Jerusalem. It began as a colony established by German Templars in 1873. The colony was built in the Valley of Rephaim on the way to Bethlehem, next to the Greek Colony. The main street of the neighbourhood today is Emek Refaim Street. The Rephaim River passes through the valley. It is also known as "White Valley". == Other websites == * the German Colony in Jerusalem from the Jerusalem webshots site Category:Neighbourhoods of Jerusalem
title: German Colony, Jerusalem
